sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: RINGWOOD a market-town of Hampshire, in the division of the Ncw Forest, ninety miles from London. It is situated on the river Avon, is well built, has a handsome church, and a good market on Wednesday. It has been long celebrated for the excellence of the strong beer which is brewed there. The population amounted in 1801 to 3222, in 1811 to 3269, in 1821 to 3471, and in 1831 to 3434.
